After reviewing the code provided by your colleagues, I have identified a few areas for improvement:

1. The code provided by the Programming Expert is well-structured and follows best practices for linear programming optimization problems. However, it lacks the implementation of the constraints related to non-negativity for the decision variables x and y. It is essential to include these constraints in the model to ensure that the solution is valid.

2. The code could benefit from including comments to explain the purpose of each section of code, such as defining decision variables, setting the objective function, adding constraints, and optimizing the model. This will make the code more readable and easier to understand for other developers.

3. It would be helpful to include a print statement to display the optimal values of x and y (the number of regular and special sandwiches made) along with the objective value (profit) at the end of the function. This will provide a clear output for the user to understand the optimal solution.

Overall, the code is well-structured and implements the objective function and constraints correctly. By addressing the mentioned areas for improvement, the code will be more robust and easier to maintain in the future.
